intro: Uterveria eustachiana, commonly known as the Eustachian uterveria, is a rare flowering plant native to the high altitudes of the Andes in South America. It is characterized by its compact, shrub-like growth habit and produces small, bell-shaped flowers that are typically greenish-white in color. The plant thrives in cool, moist environments and is often found in cloud forest ecosystems. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and covered in a dense layer of fine hairs, which helps to retain moisture. Due to its restricted distribution and habitat specificity, Uterveria eustachiana is considered a vulnerable species.
